Description: Mould-made pottery lamp with a deep double-convex body, a long round-topped nozzle with a rounded end, and an indistinct base-ring. The wick-hole is large and trumpet-shaped, and the filling-hole is surrounded by a slightly raised ridge. The shoulder is decorated with concentric semicircles and rows of beads. On top of the nozzle is a palmette. Traces of a purple slip remain.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q566)
